æ–¹æ¡ˆè¯¦è¿°

Air vortex

An air vortex is a ring of air that typically has a toroidal shape and is capable of traveling at high speeds over large distances. Unlike laminar airflow which quickly disperses, a vortex is capable of keeping its shape and form.

å…¸å‹çš„ air vortexï¼Œå¦‚smoke ring å’Œ air vortex cannonï¼Œå…¶ç‰¹ç‚¹æ˜¯ï¼š

An air vortex cannon is a device that releases doughnut-shaped air vortices â€” similar to smoke rings but larger, stronger and invisible. A toy commercial version, with a barrel 12 inches (30 cm) wide and useful range of 20 feet (6.1 m) is sold under the name Air bazooka or Airzooka
